body:
I feel like the warning is still not caught in `test_nn.py`, sigh... The following ~~works fine though:~~ only works locally ...
```
def fn():
    with torch.backends.cudnn.flags(benchmark=True, deterministic=True):
        pass

with warnings.catch_warnings(record=True) as ws:
    warnings.simplefilter("always")  # allow any warning to be raised
    fn()
    print('caught warnings: %s ' % ws[-1].message)
```

def fn():
    with torch.backends.cudnn.flags(benchmark=True, deterministic=True):
        pass

with warnings.catch_warnings(record=True) as ws:

I feel like the warning is still not caught in test_nn.py, sigh... The following works fine though: only works locally ...
def fn():
    with torch.backends.cudnn.flags(benchmark=True, deterministic=True):
        pass

with warnings.catch_warnings(record=True) as ws:
    warnings.simplefilter("always")  # allow any warning to be raised
    fn()
    print('caught warnings: %s ' % ws[-1].message)
